revised_title: Rheological Factors in Platelet-Vessel Wall Interactions and Thrombus Formation
tldr: This article explores the role of rheological factors in platelet-vessel wall interactions and thrombus formation. It discusses the effects of blood flow, platelet aggregation, and the interaction between platelets and the vessel wall. The authors also analyze the growth rates of thrombi and the activation delay time of platelets in different blood flow rates. This research provides insights into the understanding of hemostasis and thrombosis processes.
